FuncDef: The reset default-configuration command deletes the default configuration file on a device.
Examples: Warning: The action will delete the default configuration file on the device.

The default configuration file will be cleared to reconfigure.No default configuration file is set for the device. When the device is started without the next startup configuration, the plug-and-play function may be affected.Continue? [Y/N]: y
Info: Succeeded in clearing the configuration on the device.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To delete the default configuration file, run the reset default-configuration command.
The command can be configured only on a physical system (PS).
Configuration Impact
If the default configuration file is deleted, it will not be used for configuration restoration after the device starts with base configuration next time.
Precautions
Exercise caution when using the command, and you are recommended to use it under the supervision of technical support personnel.If the default configuration file is cleared and no configuration file is set for next startup, the plug-and-play function may be affected during the next startup.
